trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Lehighton
There were no other sightings in Lehighton on or around August 6th 2006
Summary: Bright twinkling reddish lights; appear to be 3 of them arranged like a triangle
divs: sighting detailsour family had returned from a picnic. everyone went to bed except my 22-year old son and i. i asked him what he was looking at outside, and he said he wasn't sure. this drew me outside, so we both sat on the bench and watched this object, about the size of a small plane at a short distance away. at first i thought it was indeed a small plane which was traveling straight away from us, since i didn't see any movement, but after my eyes adjusted to the darkness, i could see that it was hovering almost like a pendulum, going slowly side to side and occasionally up and down. it had twinkling\pulsating reddish lights. i'm familiar with what stars, planets, and satellites look like, but this thing did not appear to be like any of them, nor was it any kind of tower. i made sure my eyes weren't playing tricks on me (i was completely sober, too). the object made no noise, and it appeared almost like someone was dangling it from the sky, suspended over the land or the nearby lake and twinkling brightly. that first night, it stayed twinkling for about 15 minutes (we don't know how long it had been there before my son spied it), and gradually the lights faded out, one by one. he claims he saw the exact type of object when fishing last summer over another lake (we now live near a different lake, 20 miles to the east of that one). last night, on a whim, i went out back and saw the same object again, doing the same thing, twinkling\moving\hovering slowly, and it was still there when i went to bed. i even walked to a different spot among the trees where lights wouldn't impede my viewing, and it was as bright as the brightest twinkling star, only with a reddish cast. my son said he had seen it the previous night while he was fishing. so these are several sightings, over the course of a year or so by my son, and just this month for me. we've only noticed it around 11:00 or so, and my son sees it around 2 am when he's out fishing. i'd like to know what the heck it is so i can get a decent night's sleep. it doesn't make sense to take a photo of it, since it only looks like a very bright star; we don't have a video camera.
